channel.title: Connect to I2P router running on an other machine
channel.description:
WS and GW running on the host as VMs. An I2P router is running on an other machine, it can be reached from the host.
Is there a way (preferably safe one) to let the WS use the I2P router for eepsites?

item.title: Connect to I2P router running on an other machine
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
There has been major progress on I2PBOX:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/I2P#Installing_I2P_on_Whonix-Gateway_.28I2PBOX.29

Read full topic
item.source: Connect to I2P router running on an other machine

item.title: Connect to I2P router running on an other machine
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
In theory, yes.

There once was a similar idea, i2pBOX:

Whonix – 4 Mar 20

Dev/Inspiration - Whonix

Inspiration for developing new Whonix ™ Features.

Whonix-Gateway in theory could accept these connections, forward them elsewhere using an encrypted tunnel (VPN/SSH or so), where they get answered by i2p.

Sorry, I can’t provide step by step instructions. Would require too much research and testing. Too much workload.

Read full topic
item.source: Connect to I2P router running on an other machine
